Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இல்வாழ்வான் என்பான் இயல்புடைய மூவர்க்கும்நல்லாற்றின் நின்ற துணை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: He will be called a (true) householder, who is a firm support to the virtuous of the three orders in their good path.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A virtuous householder ('இல்வாழ்வான்') stands strong and central, depicted as the trunk of a great, flourishing Banyan tree.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The three main branches of the tree extend outwards, providing shelter and support to the 'three orders' ('மூவர்'): a young student (Brahmachari) reading a scroll, a meditating ascetic (Sanyasi), and a couple performing rites in the forest (Vanaprastha).
Layered_Composition.Background: A serene and prosperous village scene, indicating that the householder's support for the virtuous orders is the foundation of a well-ordered society.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The ideal householder visualized as the central pillar of society, providing the essential support for those in other stages or paths of life.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The Banyan tree is a powerful symbol of stability, shelter, and life. The roots of the tree are firmly planted in the 'home' (இல்). The householder is not just giving money, but offering a 'good path' ('நல்லாற்றின்') and firm support ('துணை').
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Warm, benevolent sunlight filters through the leaves of the banyan tree. The palette is rich with earthy browns, deep greens, and the warm tones of a harmonious society.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Low-angle wide shot, looking up at the householder-tree to emphasize their strength and the sheltering nature of their role.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with detailed textures on the tree bark and the serene expressions of all the figures.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Soft, dappled light filtering through the leaves, creating a sense of peace and shelter.
